name: mrouzia
ingredients: 800g to 1kg of lamb or mutton neck (or shoulder/leg)
steps: Prepare the marinade: Mix the powdered spices (ras al-hanout, ginger, cinnamon, turmeric), saffron threads, crushed garlic, and half a glass of water. Coat the meat with this marinade. Let it marinate (ideally overnight) in the fridge.
In a tagine or pot, heat the olive oil. Brown the sliced onions.
Add the marinated meat. Brown the meat on all sides.
Add the raisins (previously soaked) and honey. Cover the meat with water or broth. Season with salt and pepper.
Cover and simmer on very low heat for 2 to 3 hours, until the meat is very tender and the sauce is reduced and syrupy.
Serve hot, garnished with the toasted almonds. Traditionally served with couscous or bread.
